40class InstructionStream;

44// Convenience for platform-independent signatures. We do not normally
45// distinguish memory operands from other operands on ia32.
46using MemOperand = Operand;
47
48// TODO(victorgomes): Move definition to macro-assembler.h, once all other
49// platforms are updated.
50enum class StackLimitKind { kInterruptStackLimit, kRealStackLimit };
51
52// Convenient class to access arguments below the stack pointer.
53class StackArgumentsAccessor {
54 public:
55 // argc = the number of arguments not including the receiver.
56 explicit StackArgumentsAccessor(Register argc) : argc_(argc) {
57 DCHECK_NE(argc_, no_reg);
58 }
59
60 // Argument 0 is the receiver (despite argc not including the receiver).
61 Operand operator[](int index) const { return GetArgumentOperand(index); }
62
63 Operand GetArgumentOperand(int index) const;
64 Operand GetReceiverOperand() const { return GetArgumentOperand(0); }
65
66 private:
67 const Register argc_;
68
69 DISALLOW_IMPLICIT_CONSTRUCTORS(StackArgumentsAccessor);
70};
71
72class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE MacroAssembler
73 : public SharedMacroAssembler<MacroAssembler> {
74 public:
75 using SharedMacroAssembler<MacroAssembler>::SharedMacroAssembler;
76
77 void MemoryChunkHeaderFromObject(Register object, Register header);
78 void CheckPageFlag(Register object, Register scratch, int mask, Condition cc,
79 Label* condition_met,
80 Label::Distance condition_met_distance = Label::kFar);
81
82 // Activation support.
83 void EnterFrame(StackFrame::Type type);
84 void EnterFrame(StackFrame::Type type, bool load_constant_pool_pointer_reg) {
85 // Out-of-line constant pool not implemented on ia32.
86 UNREACHABLE();
87 }
88 void LeaveFrame(StackFrame::Type type);
89
90// Allocate stack space of given size (i.e. decrement {esp} by the value
91// stored in the given register, or by a constant). If you need to perform a
92// stack check, do it before calling this function because this function may
93// write into the newly allocated space. It may also overwrite the given
94// register's value, in the version that takes a register.
95#ifdef V8_OS_WIN
96 void AllocateStackSpace(Register bytes_scratch);
97 void AllocateStackSpace(int bytes);
98#else
99 void AllocateStackSpace(Register bytes) { sub(esp, bytes); }
100 void AllocateStackSpace(int bytes) {
101 DCHECK_GE(bytes, 0);
102 if (bytes == 0) return;
103 sub(esp, Immediate(bytes));
104 }
105#endif
106
107 // Print a message to stdout and abort execution.
108 void Abort(AbortReason reason);
109
110 // Calls Abort(msg) if the condition cc is not satisfied.
111 // Use --debug_code to enable.
112 void Assert(Condition cc, AbortReason reason) NOOP_UNLESS_DEBUG_CODE;
113
114 // Like Assert(), but without condition.
115 // Use --debug_code to enable.
116 void AssertUnreachable(AbortReason reason) NOOP_UNLESS_DEBUG_CODE;
117
118 // Like Assert(), but always enabled.
119 void Check(Condition cc, AbortReason reason);
120
121 // Check that the stack is aligned.
122 void CheckStackAlignment();
123
124 // Align to natural boundary
125 void AlignStackPointer();
126
127 // Move a constant into a destination using the most efficient encoding.
128 void Move(Register dst, int32_t x) {
129 if (x == 0) {
130 xor_(dst, dst);
131 } else {
132 mov(dst, Immediate(x));
133 }
134 }
135 void Move(Register dst, const Immediate& src);
136 void Move(Register dst, Tagged<Smi> src) { Move(dst, Immediate(src)); }
137 void Move(Register dst, Handle<HeapObject> src);
138 void Move(Register dst, Register src);
139 void Move(Register dst, Operand src);
140 void Move(Operand dst, const Immediate& src);
141
142 // Move an immediate into an XMM register.
143 void Move(XMMRegister dst, uint32_t src);
144 void Move(XMMRegister dst, uint64_t src);
145 void Move(XMMRegister dst, float src) {
146 Move(dst, base::bit_cast<uint32_t>(src));
147 }
148 void Move(XMMRegister dst, double src) {
149 Move(dst, base::bit_cast<uint64_t>(src));
150 }
151
152 Operand EntryFromBuiltinAsOperand(Builtin builtin);
153
154 void Call(Register reg) { call(reg); }
155 void Call(Operand op) { call(op); }
156 void Call(Label* target) { call(target); }
157 void Call(Handle<Code> code_object, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
158
159 // Load the builtin given by the Smi in |builtin_index| into |target|.
160 void LoadEntryFromBuiltinIndex(Register builtin_index, Register target);
161 void CallBuiltinByIndex(Register builtin_index, Register target);
162 void CallBuiltin(Builtin builtin);
163 void TailCallBuiltin(Builtin builtin);

167 CodeEntrypointTag = kDefaultCodeEntrypointTag);
168 void CallCodeObject(Register code_object);

170 JumpMode jump_mode = JumpMode::kJump);

174 void JumpJSFunction(Register function_object,
175 JumpMode jump_mode = JumpMode::kJump);

178 void Jump(Handle<Code> code_object, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);

180 void LoadLabelAddress(Register dst, Label* lbl);
181
182 void LoadMap(Register destination, Register object);

184 void LoadFeedbackVector(Register dst, Register closure, Register scratch,

188 void DebugBreak();

194 // Jump the register contains a smi.
195 inline void JumpIfSmi(Register value, Label* smi_label,
196 Label::Distance distance = Label::kFar) {
197 test(value, Immediate(kSmiTagMask));
198 j(zero, smi_label, distance);
199 }
200 // Jump if the operand is a smi.
201 inline void JumpIfSmi(Operand value, Label* smi_label,
202 Label::Distance distance = Label::kFar) {
203 test(value, Immediate(kSmiTagMask));
204 j(zero, smi_label, distance);
205 }
206
207 void JumpIfEqual(Register a, int32_t b, Label* dest) {
208 cmp(a, Immediate(b));
209 j(equal, dest);
210 }
211
212 void JumpIfLessThan(Register a, int32_t b, Label* dest) {
213 cmp(a, Immediate(b));
214 j(less, dest);
215 }
216
217 void SmiUntag(Register reg) { sar(reg, kSmiTagSize); }
218 void SmiUntag(Register output, Register value) {
219 mov(output, value);
220 SmiUntag(output);
221 }
222
223 void SmiToInt32(Register reg) { SmiUntag(reg); }
224
225 // Before calling a C-function from generated code, align arguments on stack.
226 // After aligning the frame, arguments must be stored in esp[0], esp[4],
227 // etc., not pushed. The argument count assumes all arguments are word sized.
228 // Some compilers/platforms require the stack to be aligned when calling
229 // C++ code.
230 // Needs a scratch register to do some arithmetic. This register will be
231 // trashed.
232 void PrepareCallCFunction(int num_arguments, Register scratch);
233
234 // Calls a C function and cleans up the space for arguments allocated
235 // by PrepareCallCFunction. The called function is not allowed to trigger a
236 // garbage collection, since that might move the code and invalidate the
237 // return address (unless this is somehow accounted for by the called
238 // function).
239 int CallCFunction(
240 ExternalReference function, int num_arguments,
241 SetIsolateDataSlots set_isolate_data_slots = SetIsolateDataSlots::kYes,
242 Label* return_location = nullptr);
243 int CallCFunction(
244 Register function, int num_arguments,
245 SetIsolateDataSlots set_isolate_data_slots = SetIsolateDataSlots::kYes,
246 Label* return_location = nullptr);
247
248 void ShlPair(Register high, Register low, uint8_t imm8);
249 void ShlPair_cl(Register high, Register low);
250 void ShrPair(Register high, Register low, uint8_t imm8);
251 void ShrPair_cl(Register high, Register low);
252 void SarPair(Register high, Register low, uint8_t imm8);
253 void SarPair_cl(Register high, Register low);
254
255 // Generates function and stub prologue code.
256 void StubPrologue(StackFrame::Type type);
257 void Prologue();

263 ArgumentsCountMode mode);

309 enum class PushArrayOrder { kNormal, kReverse };
310 // `array` points to the first element (the lowest address).
311 // `array` and `size` are not modified.
312 void PushArray(Register array, Register size, Register scratch,
313 PushArrayOrder order = PushArrayOrder::kNormal);
314
315 // Operand pointing to an external reference.
316 // May emit code to set up the scratch register. The operand is
317 // only guaranteed to be correct as long as the scratch register
318 // isn't changed.
319 // If the operand is used more than once, use a scratch register
320 // that is guaranteed not to be clobbered.
321 Operand ExternalReferenceAsOperand(ExternalReference reference,
322 Register scratch);
323 Operand ExternalReferenceAddressAsOperand(ExternalReference reference);
324 Operand HeapObjectAsOperand(Handle<HeapObject> object);
325
326 void LoadAddress(Register destination, ExternalReference source);
327
328 void CompareRoot(Register with, RootIndex index);
329 void CompareRoot(Register with, Register scratch, RootIndex index);
330
331 // Return and drop arguments from stack, where the number of arguments
332 // may be bigger than 2^16 - 1. Requires a scratch register.
333 void Ret(int bytes_dropped, Register scratch);

335 void PextrdPreSse41(Register dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8);
336 void PinsrdPreSse41(XMMRegister dst, Register src, uint8_t imm8,
337 uint32_t* load_pc_offset) {
338 PinsrdPreSse41(dst, Operand(src), imm8, load_pc_offset);
339 }
340 void PinsrdPreSse41(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t imm8,
341 uint32_t* load_pc_offset);
342
343 // Expression support
344 // cvtsi2sd instruction only writes to the low 64-bit of dst register, which
345 // hinders register renaming and makes dependence chains longer. So we use
346 // xorps to clear the dst register before cvtsi2sd to solve this issue.
347 void Cvtsi2ss(XMMRegister dst, Register src) { Cvtsi2ss(dst, Operand(src)); }
348 void Cvtsi2ss(XMMRegister dst, Operand src);
349 void Cvtsi2sd(XMMRegister dst, Register src) { Cvtsi2sd(dst, Operand(src)); }
350 void Cvtsi2sd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src);
351
352 void Cvtui2ss(XMMRegister dst, Register src, Register tmp) {
353 Cvtui2ss(dst, Operand(src), tmp);
354 }
355 void Cvtui2ss(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, Register tmp);
356 void Cvttss2ui(Register dst, XMMRegister src, XMMRegister tmp) {
357 Cvttss2ui(dst, Operand(src), tmp);
358 }
359 void Cvttss2ui(Register dst, Operand src, XMMRegister tmp);
360 void Cvtui2sd(XMMRegister dst, Register src, Register scratch) {
361 Cvtui2sd(dst, Operand(src), scratch);
362 }
363 void Cvtui2sd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, Register scratch);
364 void Cvttsd2ui(Register dst, XMMRegister src, XMMRegister tmp) {
365 Cvttsd2ui(dst, Operand(src), tmp);
366 }
367 void Cvttsd2ui(Register dst, Operand src, XMMRegister tmp);
368
369 void Push(Register src) { push(src); }
370 void Push(Operand src) { push(src); }
371 void Push(Immediate value);
372 void Push(Handle<HeapObject> handle) { push(Immediate(handle)); }
373 void Push(Tagged<Smi> smi) { Push(Immediate(smi)); }
374 void Push(XMMRegister src, Register scratch) {
375 movd(scratch, src);
376 push(scratch);
377 }
378
379 void Pop(Register dst) { pop(dst); }
380 void Pop(Operand dst) { pop(dst); }
381 void Pop(XMMRegister dst, Register scratch) {
382 pop(scratch);
383 movd(dst, scratch);
384 }

387 void MaybeRestoreRegisters(RegList registers);

390 SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode);
391
392 void CallRecordWriteStubSaveRegisters(
393 Register object, Register slot_address, SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode,

395 void CallRecordWriteStub(

398
399 // Calculate how much stack space (in bytes) are required to store caller
400 // registers excluding those specified in the arguments.
401 int RequiredStackSizeForCallerSaved(SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode,
402 Register exclusion = no_reg) const;
403
404 // PushCallerSaved and PopCallerSaved do not arrange the registers in any
405 // particular order so they are not useful for calls that can cause a GC.
406 // The caller can exclude a register that does not need to be saved and
407 // restored.
408
409 // Push caller saved registers on the stack, and return the number of bytes
410 // stack pointer is adjusted.
411 int PushCallerSaved(SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode, Register exclusion = no_reg);
412 // Restore caller saved registers from the stack, and return the number of
413 // bytes stack pointer is adjusted.
414 int PopCallerSaved(SaveFPRegsMode fp_mode, Register exclusion = no_reg);
415
416 // Compute the start of the generated instruction stream from the current PC.
417 // This is an alternative to embedding the {CodeObject} handle as a reference.
418 void ComputeCodeStartAddress(Register dst);
419
420 // Control-flow integrity:
421
422 // Define a function entrypoint. This doesn't emit any code for this
423 // architecture, as control-flow integrity is not supported for it.
424 void CodeEntry() {}
425 // Define an exception handler.
426 void ExceptionHandler() {}
427 // Define an exception handler and bind a label.
428 void BindExceptionHandler(Label* label) { bind(label); }
429
430 void PushRoot(RootIndex index);
431
432 // Compare the object in a register to a value and jump if they are equal.
433 void JumpIfRoot(Register with, RootIndex index, Label* if_equal,
434 Label::Distance if_equal_distance = Label::kFar) {
435 CompareRoot(with, index);
436 j(equal, if_equal, if_equal_distance);
437 }
438
439 // Compare the object in a register to a value and jump if they are not equal.
440 void JumpIfNotRoot(Register with, RootIndex index, Label* if_not_equal,
441 Label::Distance if_not_equal_distance = Label::kFar) {
442 CompareRoot(with, index);
443 j(not_equal, if_not_equal, if_not_equal_distance);
444 }
445
446 // Checks if value is in range [lower_limit, higher_limit] using a single
447 // comparison. Flags CF=1 or ZF=1 indicate the value is in the range
448 // (condition below_equal). It is valid, that |value| == |scratch| as far as
449 // this function is concerned.
450 void CompareRange(Register value, unsigned lower_limit, unsigned higher_limit,
451 Register scratch);
452 void JumpIfIsInRange(Register value, unsigned lower_limit,
453 unsigned higher_limit, Register scratch,
454 Label* on_in_range,
455 Label::Distance near_jump = Label::kFar);
456
457 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
458 // GC Support
459 // Notify the garbage collector that we wrote a pointer into an object.
460 // |object| is the object being stored into, |value| is the object being
461 // stored. value and scratch registers are clobbered by the operation.
462 // The offset is the offset from the start of the object, not the offset from
463 // the tagged HeapObject pointer. For use with FieldOperand(reg, off).
464 void RecordWriteField(Register object, int offset, Register value,
465 Register scratch, SaveFPRegsMode save_fp,
466 SmiCheck smi_check = SmiCheck::kInline);
467
468 // For page containing |object| mark region covering |address|
469 // dirty. |object| is the object being stored into, |value| is the
470 // object being stored. The address and value registers are clobbered by the
471 // operation. RecordWrite filters out smis so it does not update the
472 // write barrier if the value is a smi.
473 void RecordWrite(Register object, Register address, Register value,
474 SaveFPRegsMode save_fp,
475 SmiCheck smi_check = SmiCheck::kInline);
476
477 // Allocates an EXIT/BUILTIN_EXIT/API_CALLBACK_EXIT frame with given number
478 // of slots in non-GCed area.
479 void EnterExitFrame(int extra_slots, StackFrame::Type frame_type,
480 Register c_function);
481 void LeaveExitFrame(Register scratch);
482
483 // Load the global proxy from the current context.
484 void LoadGlobalProxy(Register dst);
485
486 // Load a value from the native context with a given index.
487 void LoadNativeContextSlot(Register dst, int index);

489 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
490 // JavaScript invokes
491
492 // Invoke the JavaScript function code by either calling or jumping.
493
494 void InvokeFunctionCode(Register function, Register new_target,
495 Register expected_parameter_count,
496 Register actual_parameter_count, InvokeType type);
497
498 // On function call, call into the debugger.
499 // This may clobber ecx.
500 void CallDebugOnFunctionCall(Register fun, Register new_target,
501 Register expected_parameter_count,
502 Register actual_parameter_count);
503
504 // Invoke the JavaScript function in the given register. Changes the
505 // current context to the context in the function before invoking.
506 void InvokeFunction(Register function, Register new_target,
507 Register actual_parameter_count, InvokeType type);
508
509 // Compare object type for heap object.
510 // Incoming register is heap_object and outgoing register is map.
511 void CmpObjectType(Register heap_object, InstanceType type, Register map);
512
513 // Compare instance type for map.
514 void CmpInstanceType(Register map, InstanceType type);
515
516 // Compare instance type ranges for a map (lower_limit and higher_limit
517 // inclusive).
518 //
519 // Always use unsigned comparisons: below_equal for a positive
520 // result.
521 void CmpInstanceTypeRange(Register map, Register instance_type_out,
522 Register scratch, InstanceType lower_limit,
523 InstanceType higher_limit);
524
525 // Smi tagging support.
526 void SmiTag(Register reg) {
527 static_assert(kSmiTag == 0);
528 static_assert(kSmiTagSize == 1);
529 add(reg, reg);
530 }
531
532 // Simple comparison of smis. Both sides must be known smis to use these,
533 // otherwise use Cmp.
534 void SmiCompare(Register smi1, Register smi2);
535 void SmiCompare(Register dst, Tagged<Smi> src);
536 void SmiCompare(Register dst, Operand src);
537 void SmiCompare(Operand dst, Register src);
538 void SmiCompare(Operand dst, Smi src);
539
540 // Jump if register contain a non-smi.
541 inline void JumpIfNotSmi(Register value, Label* not_smi_label,
542 Label::Distance distance = Label::kFar) {
543 test(value, Immediate(kSmiTagMask));
544 j(not_zero, not_smi_label, distance);
545 }
546 // Jump if the operand is not a smi.
547 inline void JumpIfNotSmi(Operand value, Label* smi_label,
548 Label::Distance distance = Label::kFar) {
549 test(value, Immediate(kSmiTagMask));
550 j(not_zero, smi_label, distance);
551 }
552
553 template <typename Field>
554 void DecodeField(Register reg) {
555 static const int shift = Field::kShift;
556 static const int mask = Field::kMask >> Field::kShift;
557 if (shift != 0) {
558 sar(reg, shift);
559 }
560 and_(reg, Immediate(mask));
561 }

563 void TestCodeIsMarkedForDeoptimization(Register code);
564 Immediate ClearedValue() const;

567 void AssertFeedbackCell(Register object,
568 Register scratch) NOOP_UNLESS_DEBUG_CODE;

572 Register closure, Register scratch1,

578 void OptimizeCodeOrTailCallOptimizedCodeSlot(
579 Register flags, XMMRegister saved_feedback_vector);

594 Register scratch) NOOP_UNLESS_DEBUG_CODE;

615 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
616 // Exception handling
617
618 // Push a new stack handler and link it into stack handler chain.
619 void PushStackHandler(Register scratch);
620
621 // Unlink the stack handler on top of the stack from the stack handler chain.
622 void PopStackHandler(Register scratch);
623
624 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
625 // Runtime calls
626
627 // Call a runtime routine.
628 void CallRuntime(const Runtime::Function* f, int num_arguments);
629
630 // Convenience function: Same as above, but takes the fid instead.
631 void CallRuntime(Runtime::FunctionId fid) {
632 const Runtime::Function* function = Runtime::FunctionForId(fid);
633 CallRuntime(function, function->nargs);
634 }
635
636 // Convenience function: Same as above, but takes the fid instead.
637 void CallRuntime(Runtime::FunctionId fid, int num_arguments) {
638 CallRuntime(Runtime::FunctionForId(fid), num_arguments);
639 }
640
641 // Convenience function: tail call a runtime routine (jump).
642 void TailCallRuntime(Runtime::FunctionId fid);
643
644 // Jump to a runtime routine.
645 void JumpToExternalReference(const ExternalReference& ext,
646 bool builtin_exit_frame = false);
647
648 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
649 // Utilities
650
651 // Emit code to discard a non-negative number of pointer-sized elements
652 // from the stack, clobbering only the esp register.
653 void Drop(int element_count);
654
655 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
656 // In-place weak references.
657 void LoadWeakValue(Register in_out, Label* target_if_cleared);
658
659 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
660 // StatsCounter support
661
662 void IncrementCounter(StatsCounter* counter, int value, Register scratch) {
663 if (!v8_flags.native_code_counters) return;
664 EmitIncrementCounter(counter, value, scratch);
665 }
666 void EmitIncrementCounter(StatsCounter* counter, int value, Register scratch);
667 void DecrementCounter(StatsCounter* counter, int value, Register scratch) {
668 if (!v8_flags.native_code_counters) return;
669 EmitDecrementCounter(counter, value, scratch);
670 }
671 void EmitDecrementCounter(StatsCounter* counter, int value, Register scratch);
672
673 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
674 // Stack limit utilities
675 void CompareStackLimit(Register with, StackLimitKind kind);
676 Operand StackLimitAsOperand(StackLimitKind kind);
677
678 void StackOverflowCheck(Register num_args, Register scratch,
679 Label* stack_overflow, bool include_receiver = false);
680
681 protected:
682 // Drops arguments assuming that the return address was already popped.
683 void DropArguments(Register count, ArgumentsCountType type = kCountIsInteger,
684 ArgumentsCountMode mode = kCountExcludesReceiver);
685
686 private:
687 // Helper functions for generating invokes.
688 void InvokePrologue(Register expected_parameter_count,
689 Register actual_parameter_count, Label* done,
690 InvokeType type);
691
692 DISALLOW_IMPLICIT_CONSTRUCTORS(MacroAssembler);
693};
694
695// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
696// Static helper functions.
697
698// Generate an Operand for loading a field from an object.
699inline Operand FieldOperand(Register object, int offset) {
700 return Operand(object, offset - kHeapObjectTag);
701}
702
703// Generate an Operand for loading an indexed field from an object.
704inline Operand FieldOperand(Register object, Register index, ScaleFactor scale,
705 int offset) {
706 return Operand(object, index, scale, offset - kHeapObjectTag);
707}
708
709// Provides access to exit frame stack space (not GC-ed).
710inline Operand ExitFrameStackSlotOperand(int offset) {
711 return Operand(esp, offset);
712}
713
714// Provides access to exit frame parameters (GC-ed).
715inline Operand ExitFrameCallerStackSlotOperand(int index) {
716 return Operand(ebp,
717 (BuiltinExitFrameConstants::kFixedSlotCountAboveFp + index) *
718 kSystemPointerSize);
719}
720
721struct MoveCycleState {
722 // Whether a move in the cycle needs the double scratch register.
723 bool pending_double_scratch_register_use = false;
724};
725
726// Calls an API function. Allocates HandleScope, extracts returned value
727// from handle and propagates exceptions. Clobbers esi, edi and caller-saved
728// registers. Restores context. On return removes
729// *stack_space_operand * kSystemPointerSize or stack_space * kSystemPointerSize
730// (GCed).
731void CallApiFunctionAndReturn(MacroAssembler* masm, bool with_profiling,
732 Register function_address,
733 ExternalReference thunk_ref, Register thunk_arg,
734 int stack_space, Operand* stack_space_operand,
735 Operand return_value_operand);
736
737#define ACCESS_MASM(masm) masm->
738
739} // namespace internal
740} // namespace v8
741
742#endif // V8_CODEGEN_IA32_MACRO_ASSEMBLER_IA32_H_
